alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 10:52AM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW OVERSPREADING THE AREA TONIGHT, THEN WINDY WITH PERIODS OF SNOW ON WEDNESDAY... .A strengthening low pressure system will head east from the Plains today. The system will slowly track across the area tonight and Wednesday morning, then shift into northern Lower Michigan Wednesday afternoon. Snow from the system will overspread the area tonight and continue into Wednesday. Winds will also increase considerably on Wednesday, resulting in some blowing and drifting snow and reduced visibility. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 8 inches. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult. Blowing and drifting snow could reduce the visibility in open areas on Wednesday. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and afternoon commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
